results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: The Draughtsman's contract
results.creator_credit: Channel Four Television, David Payne and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: It is the summer of 1694. An ambitious young draughtsman is contracted to draw the house and estate of the wealthy Mrs Herbert. However, what outwardly appears to be a most proper household is thrown into chaos as his contract includes unrestricted freedom on the estate and Mrs Herbert’s most intimate hospitality. Not even Mrs Herbert’s daughter escapes his charm and magnetism in this intriguing movie of murder, adultery and double values.

results.title: The Doors
results.creator_credit: Sasha Harari, Bill Graham Films, Imagine Entertainment (US), Bill Graham, A. Kitman Ho and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: With this biography of rock group The Doors, and in particular the excesses of lead singer and poet Jim Morrison, Oliver Stone’s obesession with documenting the cultural shifts in America in the 1960s found its perfect subject. Val Kilmer is engaging as Morrison, a young film student who becomes attracted to the promise and liberation of acid-tinged Haight-Ashbury. The formation of The Doors coincided with the LSD experimentation and the counter-cultural revolution in the American underground. Stone traces the band’s increasing popularity, their acceptance by the New York avant-garde, including Warhol’s Factory and Morrison’s decline through drug-abuse. As the band falls apart, only Morrison’s identification with Native American spirituality offers an escape from the materialist Hell he is in. This intense and kinetic film is both a celebration of counter-cultural revolution and a sad lament for its corruption. Co-starring Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan, Michael Madsen and a cameo by Billy Idol.

results.title: The Doom generation (D)
results.creator_credit: Why not productions, Andrea Sperling and Gregg Araki
results.brief_description: The second part in Gregg Araki’s ‘Teen apocalypse’ trilogy (“Totally fucked up” and “Nowhere” complete the trilogy), “The Doom generation” wryly proclaims itself in its opening credits as being a ‘heterosexual movie’, then boldly proceeds to be anything but. This deliriously violent road movie chronicles the doomed adventures of nihilistic trio Amy (Rose McGowan), Jordan (James Duval) and Xavier (Jonathon Schaech), who unwittingly become outlaws after a botched and bloody convenience store robbery. The three hit the road and along the way journey into the dark recesses of the American psyche, which is populated by senseless violence, right wing fascists, and surreal urban landscapes. Considered to be one of the main purveyors of ‘Queer cinema’, Araki’s bleak vision of bored and aimless youth is not without pleasure, reveling in acidic one liners, offbeat pop culture cameo’s, an abundance of sex, and a gleeful disrespect for the American mainstream. Cast includes Parker Posey, Heidi Fleiss, Cress Williams, Dustin Nguyen, Margaret Cho, Christopher Knight, Perry Farrell and Amanda Bearse.

results.title: The Disorderly orderly
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Paul Jones and Frank Tashlin
results.brief_description: In his eighth, and final, collaboration with director Frank Tashlin, Jerry Lewis plays Jerome Littlefield, a nurse in a sanatorium whose manic and clumsy antics manage to upset patients and staff alike. Lewis is given free reign here to display his usual brand of silly, goofy and slapstick physical humour. Typically, although Jerome is a sympathetic attendant, he effortlessly manages to derail those he cares for. In one hilarious scene a hypochondriac patient relays her many maladies as Lewis displays her symptoms. Another highlight is a quite mad chase through hilly streets, with an ambulance in pursuit of a freewheeling stretcher (with a stunned patient aboard), ending in a catastrophic encounter with numerous supermarket trolleys. As this comedy is set in a hospital, some salient points are made about systemic corruption and profit margins that increase with a simultaneous decline in care. But quite expectedly, the darker tones of the film are marginalised in favour of comedic set-pieces, consistent with Lewis’ other work, and highlights his talent for physical idiocy and facial expressiveness. Also stars Glenda Farrell, Everett Sloane, Karen Sharpe and Kathleen Freeman.

results.title: The Discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.creator_credit: Greenwich Film Production Paris, Serge Silberman and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: The efforts of a group of friends to dine together are continually frustrated in this often hilarious surrealistic fable. As if in a dream, things go awry for all the characters in this, Luis Bunuel’s deliciously comical and brilliantly performed masterpiece. Co-written by Bunuel and Jean-Claude Carriere. English subtitles.

results.title: The Dirty dozen
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Kenneth Hyman and Robert Aldrich
results.brief_description: A tough U.S. Army Major trains a violent group of criminals for one of the most bizarre and difficult combat assignments - a suicide mission! Their task is to infilitrate a protected German retreat, a chateau in occupied France, where the upper echelon of Generals relax. Getting in and staying alive will not be easy and the action is relentless in this extraordinarly explosive suspense film. The all-star cast includes Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, Jim Brown, Telly Savalas, Trini Lopez, Donald Sutherland, Ernest Borgnine, Richard Jaeckel, George Kennedy, Ralph Meeker and Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Diplomat
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, SBS Independent, Emerald Films, Sally Browning, Wilson Da Silva and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: For 24 years East Timor’s freedom fighter and Nobel Peace Prize winner Jose Ramos Horta campaigned to secure independence for his country, a former Portuguese colony invaded by Indonesia in 1975. This documentary follows him through the final year of East Timor’s struggle, a year that saw the fall of Indonesia’s President Suharto, the referendum to determine East Timor’s future, the overwhelming vote for independence, the devastating carnage that ensued, the subsequent intervention of United Nations peacekeepers, and Ramos Horta’s final triumphant return to his homeland. He emerges as a tenacious and beguiling character whose roles as a diplomat and peacemaker was a crucial one that helped finally deliver his country its freedom.

results.title: The Dinner game = Le Diner de cons
results.creator_credit: Sharmill Films, Alain Poire and Francis Veber
results.brief_description: Pierre Brochant (Thierry Lhermitte), a wealthy publisher, yuppie and art collector is into competitions of a completely different nature. The challenge between he and his friends is to bring an “idiot” to their regular Wednesday dinner, for an evening of culinary delights and amusing conversation at the cost of these supposedly intellectually inferior diners. Pierre’s friend thinks he is onto a winner with a boomerang salesman; Pierre thinks he is in with a good chance with Finance Ministry accountant, Francois Pignon (Jacques Villeret), a matchstick construction enthusiast. The viewer is never privy to seeing one of these dinner farces in action, instead Pierre finds himself spending time in his apartment with Francois, who kindly offers to help his new friend whose wife has just left him, and who is also now incapacitated by an injured back courtesy of a dodgy golf swing. In the space of a few short hours Pierre has a dinner party for two, with he being the sole witness to Francois’ stupidity and bearing the brunt of his actions as meddling with “idiots” moves into a different realm. Cast also includes Francis Huster, Alexandra Vandernoot and Daniel Prevost. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and George Stevens
results.brief_description: A faithful screen translation of the Broadway play, based on the book, about the harrowing experiences of the Jewish Frank family and their friends when they are forced to hide from the Nazis in an Amsterdam factory for two years. Millie Perkins is visually perfect as the young Anne Frank whose spirit gives the group courage to continue when they lose hope.
